bibl.note: This is a letter from Sam Golluday to Adam Fergusson, dated December 18, 1845. Golluday has some coffee that Fergusson purchased. He also writes that he will soon be back in business, and looks forward to having Fergusson as a client.

div.p:
I received your letter requesting me to purchase you one sk of good Rio Coffee. I have Selected it and have no doubt but it will on trial prove to be good. I purchased of
Mess Misters Martin & McAlister (at my old Stand) 1 sk 164 is $ 14.76 This Amount you can call and pay them when you come down Mr. Gibson has attended to the shipment of the coffee together with the articles you ordered from him I am in hopes in the course of the next 90 days to be again in business when I shall be pleased to have you call upon and forward your orders to me. I shall Keep Any Goods & Groceries I expect to start to the North from the 1st to the 10th of next month to select my stock
